subject: Baseball
lead_paragraph: Queens District Attorney Richard A. Brown said on Wednesday that a Brooklyn man hired by the Mets as a security guard during the demolition of Shea Stadium had pleaded guilty to petit larceny in connection with the theft of memorabilia. Gerald Tacopino, 44, was fined $500 and sentenced to a conditional discharge that requires him to repay $842.50 to the Mets. He was also barred for one year from Citi Field.
